page.title: 19RIVER FINDHORN AT FERNESS
page.content: The river flows through the north- west corner of our area,on its 60 mile course from the Monadhliath mountains to the Moray Firth near Forres. In these middle reaches it has cut some spectacularly beautiful gorges in the granite rock. The Findhorn is subject to sudden and dramatic flooding, the worst on record having occurred in August 1829. That year the road bridge near Ferness was completely submerged in the spate but survived unscathed. Another footbridge across the river from Ferness to Ardclach Church was washed away in 1958. The Findhorn is famous for its salmon fishing which is owned by Glenferness Estate. The wooded banks of the river are much enjoyed by the walker, while the rapids provide good sport for the canoeist.
